Always nice to spread the word. And I can't await SPAZ2. Rebel Galaxy also looks fun, I have a weakness for 2D spacesims (longtime Starfleet Battles boardgame player here).

Very nice to see people getting amped about it. KSP basically has created a new genre, that doesn't happen often. It's not a "Space Sim" genre game really, at least not as the term has been used since the 80's. Unfortunately the term itself is inaccurate, since "Space Sim" games are really Space Sci-fi games.

I've been playing Elite: Dangerous, which was the defining "Space Sim" franchise and I've been having loads of fun. But in my mind it doesn't even directly compete with KSP, because sometimes you want to launch rocket to the moon and other times you want to blast pirates out of the skies.

And than sooo many people pre order it, and it turns out to be full of bugs, or they downgraded the graphics that got people to pre order it in the first place, ect ect. That it keeps working only encourages publishers to keep pushing pre orders more and more aggrasively, than releasing a broken mess and let the users figure out the bugs. It's a cycle that's poisoning the industry. Me not pre ordering is a start, but just that is not going to cut it. Alot more people need to wake up before anything improves.

My problem is not with No mans Sky specificly. It's with the whole hype building around things that we know nothing about yet. Just wait until they actually DO release it. Or at the very least, release a release date, or some gameplay

I want to mention The Mandate: http://www.mandategame.com/

Ok, it won't be released this year but I think it has great potential. It focuses on social elements (crew, factions), tactical gameplay and role-playing. That's quite a unique mix and remembers me a bit about FTL: Faster than light.
